Stand up for righteousness!
Impeach, convict, REMOVE!

title: No Kings 2.0

raw_text:
NO KINGS 2.0

The Constitution establishes a system where no individual, including the President, is above the law and it actively discourages the establishment of a monarchy or any system that grants special privileges based on birth or title.

Join Us October 18th, 2025, 1PM to 3PM

George Washington Park Sidewalk on S. Pearl St.
Centralia, Washington

Organized by LD #20 Democrats, Centralia.Mobilize and Rural Lewis Indivisible

title: NO KINGS
description: Our peaceful movement is only getting bigger and stronger. “NO KINGS” is more than just a slogan—it’s the foundation our nation was built upon. Born in the streets, carried by millions in chants and on posters, it echoes from city blocks to rural town squares, uniting people across this country to fight dictatorship together. In America, we don’t have kings, and we won’t back down against chaos, corruption, and cruelty. Grow our movement and join us. A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values and to act lawfully at these events. Weapons of any kind, including those legally permitted, should not be brought to events.
raw_text:
NO THRONES. NO CROWNS. NO KINGS.
SATURDAY, OCT. 18
Time: Saturday, October 18
11am – 12:30pm MDT
Location: 7th Street & Main Street Windsor, CO 80550 Map
About this event: Our peaceful movement is only getting bigger and stronger. “NO KINGS” is more than just a slogan—it’s the foundation our nation was built upon. Born in the streets, carried by millions in chants and on posters, it echoes from city blocks to rural town squares, uniting people across this country to fight dictatorship together. In America, we don’t have kings, and we won’t back down against chaos, corruption, and cruelty. Grow our movement and join us.
📍 Where: 7th and Main Street 📅 When: 11-12:30, October 18, 2025 A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values and to act lawfully at these events. Weapons of any kind, including those legally permitted, should not be brought to events.
raw_summary: The event titled "NO KINGS" appears to be a peaceful movement promoting unity. It is scheduled for Saturday, October 18, 2025, at 7th Street & Main Street, Windsor, CO 80550. The gathering is from 11:00 AM to 12:30 PM MDT. The aim is to de-escalate potential confrontations and promote peaceful cohabitation.

title: Fighting Dictatorship Together
description: We are organizing a protest against the administration's actions, including court defiance, deportations, and service cuts. This movement is for those who think the government has gone too far.
address: At the big flag where Pacific Ave & 19th Way split
raw_text:
Fighting Dictatorship Together
SATURDAY, OCT 18

NO THRONES! NO CROWNS! NO KINGS

This is bigger than political disagreement. The administration has defied our courts, deported American citizens, disappeared people off the streets, and slashed our services—all while orchestrating a massive giveaway to their billionaire allies. Enough is enough. For anyone who thinks they’ve gone too far, this movement is for you.

AT THE BIG FLAG!
Where Pacific Ave & 19th Way split
WHEN?
4:30-6 PM on Sat, Oct 18th
DO I NEED TO BRING ANYTHING?
Bring yourself, a sign, and some friends! (Extra signs and chairs will be available.)

INDIVISIBLE OREGON
Forest Grove
indivisibleforestgrove@gmail.com | indfg.org
Let us know you’re coming: [QR Code]

title: NO KINGS
description: Join us for a rally, march, a food drive, voter registration and information, and tell your stories. We focus on nonviolent action and de-escalation.
raw_text:
POWER BELONGS TO THE PEOPLE.
JOIN THE MOVEMENT
NO KINGS
SATURDAY, OCT. 18
1:00-2:30 pm
Historic Cache Courthouse
199 N Main, Logan UT

Join us for a rally, march, a food drive, voter registration and information, and tell your stories.

Please bring non-perishable food items if you can.

More info
A core principle behind all our events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. Weapons of any kind, including those legally permitted, should not be brought to events.
raw_summary: The image promotes a rally event titled 'NO KINGS' that will include activities like a march, food drive, voter registration, and storytelling. It specifies that power belongs to the people and encourages joining the movement.

title: NO KINGS
description: Join us for a peaceful march starting at the corner of 1st and Norfolk on October 18, 2025. Participants can choose to stay at Old Mill or march to 5th St. American Flags and percussion instruments are welcome. Preparatory activities will occur on October 17, 2025, at 126 S. 4th St., where we’ll make signs and learn songs.
address: Corner of 1st and Norfolk, Next to Old Mill, 5th St.
meeting_location: On the corner of 1st and Norfolk
raw_text:
NO KINGS

October 18th, 2025
1:00-3:00pm: On the corner of 1st and Norfolk
1:30pm: Begin our march down Norfolk Ave (on the sidewalk)
Those who want/need to stay put will hold down the fort at Old Mill while those who wish to march will peacefully make our way to 5th St. and back. American Flags and percussion instruments welcome.

OCTOBER 17TH, 7:00-8:30PM
COME MAKE SIGNS AND LEARN SONGS WITH US AT 126 S. 4TH ST.
BRING SUPPLIES IF YOU CAN, BUT WE WILL ALSO HAVE SUPPLIES AVAILABLE
raw_summary: The image is a flyer for an event called "NO KINGS" taking place on October 18, 2025. It includes details about a march starting from the corner of 1st and Norfolk. There's also a preparatory event on October 17, 2025, at 126 S. 4th St.

title: No Kings March
description: Join us for a peaceful march under the theme "No Kings" starting at 1st and Norfolk. Participants are encouraged to bring American flags and percussion instruments. There will also be a preparation session on October 17th to make signs and learn songs.
raw_text:
NO KINGS
October 18th, 2025
1:00-3:00pm: On the corner of 1st and Norfolk
1:30pm: Begin our march down Norfolk Ave (on the sidewalk)
Those who want/need to stay put will hold down the fort at Old Mill while those who wish to march will peacefully make our way to 5th St. and back. American Flags and percussion instruments welcome.

October 17th, 7:00-8:30PM
Come make signs and learn songs with us at 126 S. 4th St.
Bring supplies if you can, but we will also have supplies available.

title: Skills for Disagreeing Better Workshop
description: A free Braver Angels in-person event focused on developing communication skills to improve understanding across political divides.
sponsors: The League of Women Voters Ames & Story County
raw_text: Let's learn to disagree better, TOGETHER.  Join us for a FREE workshop in Ames!  Feeling tired of the constant political division?  What if we could build the skills to communicate across our differences with respect and clarity?  This FREE in-person workshop is a Braver Angels event designed to do just that.  “Skills for Disagreeing Better” is about learning practical skills to listen so others feel heard, and to share your own views in a way that others can hear.  WHEN: Sunday, November 2nd, 2 - 4 PM CST  WHERE: Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave., Ames  COST: FREE (Donations welcome)  Scan the code below to register! Use promo code "BRAVER" and select "Free Ticket" at checkout to reserve your spot.  HOSTED BY  Ames Public Library  Indivisible Ames  The League of Women Voters Ames & Story County  Democracy Every Day  Ames Area Religious Leaders Association (AARLA)
raw_summary: The image is an invitation to a free workshop called "Skills for Disagreeing Better" hosted by Braver Angels. It's aimed at teaching communication skills for navigating political divisions. The event is scheduled for November 2nd at Ames Public Library, in Ames, Iowa. The event is hosted by multiple organizations including the Ames Public Library and Indivisible Ames.

title: Veterans Day Overpass Bannering
description: Join us for an overpass bannering event on Veterans Day to stand with veterans in defending our constitution, streets, and oaths. The event involves displaying banners reading 'No Oath to Trump' on various overpasses in the Olympia-Lacey-Tumwater area.
raw_text: VETERANS 11.11 DAY 2025 NO OATH TO TRUMP 10 AM – 1 PM JOIN US!! OLYMPIA-LACEY-TUMWATER OVERPASS BANNERING 1 TUMWATER PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE / I-5 2 CUSTER WAY / I-5 3 CAPITOL BLVD BRIDGE / I-5 4 EASTSIDE ST. / I-5 5 BOULEVARD RD SE / I-5 6 CHEHALIS-WESTERN TRAIL BRIDGE / I-5 7 SLEATER-KINNEY AVE / I-5 BANNER WITH VETERANS ON HIGHWAY OVERPASSES FROM SEA TO SHINING SEA, STAND WITH VETERANS TO DEFEND OUR CONSTITUTION, OUR STREETS, AND OUR OATHS #NOOATHTOTRUMP #OURSTREETS #VETSAGAINSTTRUMP 501 INDIVISIBLE BACKBONE CAMPAIGN VISIBILITY BRIGADE
raw_summary: The image promotes an overpass bannering event on Veterans Day, November 11, 2025, from 10 AM to 1 PM. It involves banner displays at several overpass locations in the Olympia-Lacey-Tumwater area, with messages opposing taking an oath to Trump. Sponsors include Indivisible, Backbone Campaign, and Visibility Brigade. The flyer emphasizes standing with veterans to defend constitutional values.
